page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: The farms around Langton Green and Fordcombe vary in size between about 20 and 140 hectares. Most of them go in for mixed farming, with cereal and livestock, but there are also two dairy herds. Some farms also grow potatoes and raise chickens. Some of the farms are worked by the owner while others are run by a farm manager. None have more than four labourers to assist them. All the farms own tractors and a large number of mechanical accessories such as: Combine Harvesters, Balers and Cultivators. Very little of the work is done by hand. Most fields are comparatively small when compared with places such as East Anglia or the Cotswolds and have either retained their old hedges, often of hawthorn, or are fenced with mesh and/or barbed wire.
